page.title: 20Council boundary changes
page.content: At present there are 59 memebers on Woodspring council,and because of the housing and population growth in Weston-super-mare,some areas there are under-represented. The council wishes to increase the number of councillors for Weston, partly by reducing the number for the rural areas of Woodspring. These proposals would affect Redhill and Butcombe.At present Wrington and Redhill share a councillor,but it is reccommended that Redhill should no longer be included with Wrington,but should share a councillor with Butcombe,Burrington and Blagdon. The parish councillors for Redhill object to this,as Redhill is closely linked with Wrington geographically and socially,but has little connection with Blagdon.
